issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: No response from euca-get-console-output if cluster controller not available

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue is undergoing QA.  See linked QA issue(s) for progress.
status.name: In QA

fields.description:
related to this, get-password may have the same behavior, as it is a composite operation which includes get-console-output.

This test:

{code}
export INST=`euca-run-instances emi-A633379B | grep INST | awk '{print $2}'`; while(true); do euca-get-console-output $INST; done
{code}

will create a condition where the CC->NC getConsoleOutput operation times out, at which point the CC returns a failure to the CLC.  When this happens, the end command (euca-get-console-output) hangs for a very long time (20 minutes ++).  

I believe the solution to this problem includes:

1) increase CC timeout on NC call to getConsoleOutput from 5 seconds to something higher (should permit up to 60)
2) adjust CLC to not have this behavior when CC returns an error to getConsoleOutput

Here is the wire from CC->CLC when this occurs:

{code}

fields.summary: euca-get-console-output can hang for a long time if something goes wrong on the back-end

comments.body:
Soap Body on successful call:
{code}
<soapenv:Body 
	xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd" 
	wsu:Id="SigID-f5b4dafe-de8b-1e21-3a5c">
	<n:ncGetConsoleOutputResponse xmlns:n="http://eucalyptus.ucsb.edu/">
		<n:userId>eucalyptus</n:userId>
		<n:return>true</n:return>
		<n:consoleOutput>...</n:consoleOutput>
	</n:ncGetConsoleOutputResponse>
</soapenv:Body>
{code}

Soap Body on failure call:
{code}
<soapenv:Body 
	xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd" 
	wsu:Id="SigID-30c2ff6c-4973-1e21-3f31">
	<n:GetConsoleOutputResponse xmlns:n="http://eucalyptus.ucsb.edu/">
		<n:correlationId>e17cc4a3-4783-4ee2-a439-2a0f6c41eb5c</n:correlationId>
		<n:userId>eucalyptus</n:userId>
		<n:statusMessage>ERROR</n:statusMessage>
		<n:return>false</n:return>
	</n:GetConsoleOutputResponse>
</soapenv:Body>
{code}
Fix issue in EUCA-4545-2 branch. Git hash is f7a01c2fb6688e55439ed65064c386b2bdaf467f

There is no way to specifically trigger this condition other than modifying the CC code to forcefully return an error to the CLC. Testing of this case should be focussed around the euca-get-console-output tool to make sure that 

1) Proper information is reporter
2) It no longer hangs (in general) using the test Dan was using.
